channel.title: BBC Sport | Sport Homepage | World Edition
channel.description: Visit BBC Sport for all the action as it happens - up-to-the-minute news, results, breaking news, video, audio and feature stories. BBC Sport covers the major events and all the professional football clubs in the UK, plus cricket, rugby, golf, tennis, motorsport and all the main world sports.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/help/rss/4517815.stm for terms and conditions of reuse

item.title: Roberto Carlos makes Chelsea wait
item.description: Roberto Carlos will wait until after the World Cup before opting whether to join Chelsea or stay at Real Madrid.

item.title: Rep of Ireland 0-1 Chile
item.description: A second-half strike from Manuel Iturra gives Chile a deserved victory over the Republic of Ireland in the Dublin friendly.

item.title: Police hunt Vieira gas attackers
item.description: Gas was pumped into Patrick Vieira's house before intruders stole jewellery and fled in his Mercedes.

item.title: Skipper Owen to start for England
item.description: Michael Owen will captain the England B team against Belarus on Thursday and starts the game up front with Peter Crouch.

item.title: Reds in new Gonzalez permit bid
item.description: Liverpool will make a fresh bid to secure a work permit for 21-year-old Chilean winger Mark Gonzalez.

item.title: Barrichello blames crisis on team
item.description: Rubens Barrichello says his team's lack of experience caused his troubled transition from Ferrari.

item.title: Rossi rules out switch to Ferrari
item.description: Valentino Rossi says he will stick with motorbikes for the moment rather than switch to Formula One.

item.title: Roddick & Hewitt on injury list
item.description: Andy Roddick joins Lleyton Hewitt on the list of casualties ahead of the French Open.

item.title: NSW snatch Origin victory
item.description: Brett Finch snatches victory at the death for New South Wales in the State of Origin opener.

item.title: Raul's yellow card
item.description: Striker ticked off by Spain coach for wearing 'unlucky' yellow shirt

item.title: Classy Clarke makes his mark
item.description: Darren Clarke's honesty highlights golf's unique charm

item.title: Jonathan Agnew column
item.description: "Flintoff's tactical acumen will be under scrutiny at Edgbaston"

item.title: Robbie wins World Cup poll
item.description: Martin O'Neill and Robbie Williams voted top comedy moment
